intro: Achyrocline vauthieriana, commonly known as the Vauthier's achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Cuba and the Isle of Pines. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its flowers are usually small and yellowish, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
